question: For the formation of which compound in Ellingham diagram <katex>$\Delta G^{\circ}$</katex> becomes more and more negative with increase in temperature ?
explanation: In the Ellingham diagram, the slope is equal to <katex>$-\Delta S$</katex>.

For the reaction <katex>$2C(s) + O_2(g) \rightarrow 2CO(g)$</katex>, there is an increase in the number of gaseous moles (<katex>$\Delta n_g = 1$</katex>), so entropy increases (<katex>$\Delta S > 0$</katex>).
Since <katex>$\Delta G = \Delta H - T\Delta S$</katex>, as T increases, the <katex>$-T\Delta S$</katex> term becomes more negative.
Thus, the line for **CO** slopes downwards (becomes more negative).
